Course Details

RRB - NTPC & RRC Exams Admission

S.NoRegular & Weekend BatchDuration & TimingsFees (Including Tax)
1RRB Special Course1 Year₹ 15,000
2RRB NTPC6 Months₹ 10,000
3RRB Group C & D6 Months₹ 10,000
4RRB JE6 Months₹ 20,000
5Special Course (RRB + TNPSC)1 Year₹ 20,000
6Special Course (RRB + SSC + TNPSC)1 Year₹ 20,000
7RRB Special Course (RRB + SSC1 Year₹ 20,000

Enquiry Form

Fill the form below. Our Student counsellor will get back to you shortly.

Course Includes

  • Study Materials
  • Foundation course
  • Monthly Current Affairs
  • Weekly Test

Our Highlights

  • A well-experienced faculty team
  • Individual Attention
  • Continuous Student Assessment
  • Interview Guidance
Our Admission Process:

  • We have chosen the principle of “first-come-first-served” as the basis of admission in our institute
  • The candidates or their representatives are required to be present at CHENNAI IAS ACADEMY office, with the duly filled-up application form with one passport size and one stamp size photographs, photocopy of valid photo ID & Address Proof of the candidate.
  • After admission to any of the course, if there is any indiscipline or misbehavior on the part of the students, they may be expelled, without any explanation. The right to rusticate rests solely with the management.
RRB NTPC
RRB JE (Junior Engineer) Exam
RRB ALP Exam
RRC Group – D Exam Exam

RRB NTPC Examinations

Railway Recruitment Board (RRB) conducts the RRB NTPC Exam (Non- Technical Popular Category) every year. Railway Recruitment Board conducts this exam to select eligible candidates for the position of Non- Technical Popular Category in its various zones all across the country.

Candidates opting for RRB NTPC Exam should know the Selection Procedure of the recruitment. Students will be selected on the basis of the marks scored in first & second stage whereas other stages will be qualifying in nature. Below are the following stages of the recruitment:

  • First Stage Online Examination (PT–CBT)
  • Second Stage Examination (Mains–CBT)
  • Typing Test (Skill Test)
  • Aptitude Test
  • Document Verification
  • Medical Fitness Test
  • Final Merit List

RRB NTPC Exam Pattern

RRB NTPC Exam will be conducted in two stages i.e RRB NTPC 1st stage CBT or Prelims and RRB NTPC 2nd Stage CBT or Mains Exam. Railway Recruitment board has not made many changes in Exam pattern & Syllabus for prelims and Mains.

Age Limits:

The minimum age of the candidates must be 18 years and the maximum age limit is 30 years, to be eligible for the upcoming RRB NTPC Exam.

Age Relaxation for RRB NTPC Exams:

For SC/ST candidates: 05 Years

For OBC candidates: 03 Years.

Exam Syllabus

Candidates who interested in RRB NTPC  Exam can get the details of the syllabus and scheme below

RRB NTPSC Syllabus

RRB NTPC 1st stage CBT or Prelims

S.NoName of the SectionNo. of Questions AskedMarks Allotted
1General Science4040
2General Intelligence & Reasoning3030
3Mathematics3030
Total100100

RB NTPC 2nd Stage CBT or Mains

S.NoName of the SectionNo. of Questions AskedMarks Allotted
1General Awareness5050
2Mathematics 3535
3General Intelligence & Reasoning3535
Total120120

RRB JE (Junior Engineer) Exam

Railway JE  Exam will be conducted in 4 different Phases:

  • First Stage of CBT
  • Second Stage of CBT
  • Document Verification
  • Medical Examination

Age Limits:

The lower and upper age limit indicated for post(s) in the vacancy table will be reckoned as on exam notification.
Minimum Age: 18  | Maximum Age: 30

Age Relaxation for RRB JE Exams:

For SC/ST candidates: 05 Years

For OBC candidates: 03 Years.

Exam Syllabus

Candidates who interested in RRB JE  Exam can get the details of the syllabus and scheme below

RRB JE Syllabus

First Stage of CBT

SubjectNo. of Questions
Stage – I		Mark for each Section
Stage – II
Mathematics3030
General Intelligence & Reasoning2525
General Awareness1515
General Science3030
Total100100
Time in Minutes90

Second Stage of CBT

SubjectNo. of Questions
Stage – I		Mark for each Section
Stage – II
General Awareness 1515
Physics & Chemistry1515
Basics of Computers and Applications1010
Basics of Environment & Pollution Control1010
Technical Abilities100100
Total150150
Time in Minutes120

RRB ALP Exam

The Exam Pattern for Railway Recruitment constitutes of two stages of CBT or Computer Based Test followed by Computer Based Aptitude Test (Relevant Trade) and Document Verification. Let’s have a look at both these stages of CBT in detail

Railway ALP Exam will be conducted in 4 different Phases:

  • First Stage of CBT
  • Second Stage of CBT
  • Document Verification
  • Medical Examination

Age Limits:

The lower and upper age limit indicated for post(s) in the vacancy table will be reckoned as on exam notification.
Minimum Age: 18  | Maximum Age: 30

Age Relaxation for RRB ALP Exams:

For SC/ST candidates: 05 Years

For OBC candidates: 03 Years.

Exam Syllabus

Candidates who interested in RRB ALP  Exam can get the details of the syllabus and scheme below

RRB ALP Syllabus

First stage of CBT or Prelims Exam

S.NoSubjectNo. of Questions
1Mathematics20
2General Intelligence & Reasoning25
3General Awareness on Current Affairs20
4General Science10
Total75
Time in Minutes60

Second stage of CBT or Prelims Exam

S.NoSubjectNo. of Questions
1Mathematics25
2General Intelligence & Reasoning25
3General Awareness on Current Affairs10
4Basic Science & Engineering40
Total100
Time in Minutes90

RRC Group - D Exam

Railway Recruitment Board conducts RRC Group D Level 1 railway exam giving candidates a golden opportunity to fulfill their dream of joining the prestigious Government Sector (Indian Railways) in India.

The RRC Group D Recruitment process will involve the following stages of examination:

  • Computer Based Test (CBT)
  • Physical Efficiency Test (PET)
  • Document Verification and Medical

Exam Pattern

Based on the performance of candidates in the Computer Based Test(CBT), they would be required to go for the PET/Document Verification. The examination duration and number of questions for CBT are indicated below

S.NoSubjectNo. of Questions
1Mathematics25
2General Science25
3General Awareness on Current Affairs20
4General Intelligence and Reasoning30
Total100
Time in Minutes90

Exam Syllabus

Candidates who interested in RRB ALP  Exam can get the details of the syllabus and scheme below

RRB ALP Syllabus

Age Limits:

The lower and upper age limit indicated for post(s) in the vacancy table will be reckoned as on exam notification.
Minimum Age: 18  | Maximum Age: 30

Age Relaxation for RRB ALP Exams:

For SC/ST candidates: 05 Years

For OBC candidates: 03 Years.
